solution_line_template: The amount of discount in the first store {original_price_store1} x {discount_percentage_numerator_store1}/{discount_percentage_denominator} = $<<{original_price_store1}*{discount_percentage_numerator_store1}/{discount_percentage_denominator}={discount_amount_store1}>>{discount_amount_store1}.

So, the device costs {original_price_store1} - {discount_amount_store1} = $<<{original_price_store1}-{discount_amount_store1}={price_after_discount_store1}>>{price_after_discount_store1} in the first store.

The amount of discount in the second store is {original_price_store2} x {discount_percentage_numerator_store2}/{discount_percentage_denominator} = $<<{original_price_store2}*{discount_percentage_numerator_store2}/{discount_percentage_denominator}={discount_amount_store2}>>{discount_amount_store2}.

So, the device costs {original_price_store2} - {discount_amount_store2} = $<<{original_price_store2}-{discount_amount_store2}={price_after_discount_store2}>>{price_after_discount_store2} in the second store.
